text: The 1932–33 season was the 60th season of competitive football in Scotland and the 43rd season of the Scottish Football League. == Scottish League Division One == Champions: Rangers Relegated: Greenock Morton, East Stirlingshire == Scottish League Division Two == NOTE: Armadale & Bo'ness were expelled for failing to meet match guarantees; their records were expunged. Promoted: Hibernian, Queen of the South == Scottish Cup == Celtic were winners of the Scottish Cup with a 1–0 final win over Motherwell. == Other Honours == === National === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup – North |Inverness Thistle |4 – 3 |Penicuik Athletic |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup – South |Beith |4 – 2 |Falkirk Amateurs |} === County === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Aberdeenshire Cup |Aberdeen |5 – 2 * |Buckie Thistle |- |align=left|Ayrshire Cup |Ayr United |3 – 1 |Kilmarnock |- |align=left|Dumbartonshire Cup |Dumbarton |2 – 0 |Vale Ocaba |- |align=left|East of Scotland Shield |Hearts |4 – 0 |Hibernian |- |align=left|Fife Cup |East Fife |2 – 1 |Raith Rovers |- |align=left|Forfarshire Cup |Montrose |1 – 0 |Dundee |- |align=left|Glasgow Cup |Rangers |1 – 0 |Partick Thistle |- |align=left|Lanarkshire Cup |Motherwell |7 – 5 * |Airdrie |- |align=left|Perthshire Cup |Vale of Atholl |5 – 0replay |Moulin City |- |align=left|Renfrewshire Cup |St Mirren |3 – 1 * |Morton |- |align=left|Southern Counties Cup |Stranraer | | |- |align=left|Stirlingshire Cup |Stenhousemuir |4 – 2 |Falkirk |} \- aggregate over two legs === Highland League === == Junior Cup == Yoker Athletic were winners of the Junior Cup after a 4–2 win over Tranent in the final replay. == Scotland national team == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! !Competition !Scotland scorer(s) |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |17 September 1932 |Windsor Park, Belfast (A) | |align=center|4–0 |BHC |Bob McPhail (2), James King, Jimmy McGrory |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |26 October 1932 |Tynecastle Park, Edinburgh (H) | |align=center|2–5 |BHC |Dally Duncan, Neil Dewar |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |1 April 1933 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|2–1 |BHC |Jimmy McGrory (2) |- |} Key: * (H) = Home match * (A) = Away match * BHC = British Home Championship == Notes and references == == External links == * Scottish Football Historical Archive Category:Seasons in Scottish football Scotland Scotland Scottish Football, 1932-33 In Scottish Football, 1932-33 In
title: 1932–33 in Scottish football
